title: Software Engineer Intern
description:
About Us:
Zenity is the first application security platform designed to help enterprises secure and govern copilots and low-code development. Our SaaS platform is built from the ground up with a security-first approach centered on three pillars: Visibility, Risk Assessment, and Governance to help our customers know their business applications and copilots that are being created by all business users, outside of the purview of IT. As the founding member of the OWASP Top 10 project specifically focused on low-code/no-code development, Zenity takes a community-oriented approach to this rapidly evolving security vector. We recently completed our Series A round of investment led by Intel Capital and are continuing to create a new category to bring application security controls to the world of AI and low-code development and are looking for creative thinkers and doers to help take us to the next level.
Position Overview:
We are seeking a motivated and passionate Software Engineer Intern to join our team in Tel Aviv. This internship is an excellent opportunity for a student with a strong interest in software development to gain hands-on experience and contribute to cutting-edge projects in the field of application security.
The ideal candidate will have the ability to learn, digest, and evaluate the pros and cons of various information, tools, and technologies. You should be able to present your findings clearly and methodically, and quickly adapt to new technologies, using them to code both simple and complex logic across different environments (e.g., Cloud, CI/CD). Additionally, you will perform regular development tasks as needed as part of Zenity’s engineering group.
Responsibilities:
Assist in the design, development, and maintenance of software features and tools.
Collaborate with senior engineers to deliver high-quality code that meets project requirements.
Participate in code reviews, testing, and debugging processes.
Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends and technologies, applying them to your work when relevant.
Contribute to the overall success of the engineering team by bringing fresh ideas and enthusiasm.

Requirements:

Requirements:
Student for Computer Science or Software Engineering in semester 3 and above.
GPA of 90 or higher.
Technical Skills:Wide knowledge of technologies and programming languages.
Real passion for computers and computer science.
Additional Qualifications:Advantage for work experience in software development.
Ability to work at least 2.5 days a week from the company office in Tel Aviv.

title: Senior Director of Product Management, 2 Hour Learning (Remote) - $200,000/year USD
description:
Drive the AI-powered learning revolution at 2 Hour Learning - where student success hinges on your ability to engage, empathize, and innovate.
At 2 Hour Learning, we're on a mission to flip the script on traditional education. Our academic ecosystem, powered by cutting-edge AI and learning science, is already enabling students to shatter learning goals in a fraction of the time. But we're just getting started.
You'll be the catalyst that takes our AI-driven products to new heights of engagement and efficacy. This role is for educational visionaries ready to roll up their sleeves and get into the trenches with students and staff. You'll engage with users constantly, gathering raw insights to inform each product iteration. No hiding behind focus groups or third-party reports - you'll build trust and rapport directly with the students whose lives your products will transform.
But gathering intel is just the start. You'll feed those insights into a non-stop cycle of AI-powered innovation. From generating new features with ChatGPT to automating marketing tasks to maintaining a comprehensive knowledge base, you'll wield AI as your copilot to bring products to life at light speed.
You'll also flex your leadership chops, guiding outsourced dev teams to execute on your vision and quality standards. It's full ownership, full accountability, and full potential to make a seismic impact on education. If you're ready to shape the future of learning, one user insight and AI breakthrough at a time, this is the place for you.
For more information on 2 Hour Learning, visit our website [https://2hourlearning.com/] and the Future of Education Instagram page [https://www.instagram.com/futureof_education/]. To see a school built around 2 Hour Learning, check out Alpha [https://alpha.school/].

What you will be doing
Engaging directly with students and staff to gather raw feedback and transform it into actionable product enhancements
Harnessing generative AI tools to rapidly ideate, prototype, and market new product concepts
Taking full ownership of the product lifecycle from ideation through launch and iteration, with a relentless focus on student success
Collaborating with outsourced dev teams to execute on product roadmap and maintain sky-high quality standards
Immersing yourself in learning science and emerging AI tech to fuel a constant cycle of product innovation

What you will NOT be doing
Treating product management as a purely theoretical exercise - you'll be in constant contact with actual students and users
Waiting for lengthy research cycles to guide product decisions - you'll gather insights directly and leverage AI to move fast
Passing the buck on product quality or timeline - you'll have full ownership and accountability for outcomes
Resting on your laurels or settling for incremental improvements - the mandate is to push boundaries and aim for 10x gains

Key Responsibilities
Deliver AI-powered educational products and experiences that demonstrably drive unprecedented student engagement, efficacy, and delight.

Candidate Requirements
At least 5 years of product management experience
Proficiency in leveraging AI tools for key product management tasks, including content creation, user interface optimization, and workflow automation
Proven ability to gather detailed user feedback through interviews and other methods, analyze data to identify trends and pain points, and translate insights into actionable product improvements
Demonstrated success managing development teams, ensuring their work aligns with product vision and meets rigorous quality standards
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a track record of using data to drive product decisions and measurably enhance user satisfaction
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to provide precise, actionable feedback to cross-functional teams and maintain regular, consistent communication with all stakeholders

title: Kickstart Program - 2024
description:
Job Description

The Wix Kickstart Program in Tel Aviv and Be’er Sheva is offering a unique opportunity to join Wix Engineering. As part of the program, you'll work alongside some of the leading engineers in the tech industry. After the 4-5 weeks training in Tel Aviv, you'll continue working as a developer at Wix, getting real production tasks for the most exciting engineering challenges we're solving, and enjoy a fun, collaborative working environment.
In the first few weeks of the training, we'll cover various Frontend or Backend, fundamental topics, according to your assigned team. After training, our Development teams will help you dive deeper into the Wix Engineering infrastructure, mentoring you on development tools, processes, products, and components. Then, you'll start coding for millions of users!
The program starts on November 11th for 4-5 weeks training.
Registration ends by Aug 21th
For more details : https://www.wixkickstart.com/

Qualifications

Must:
Experience in Fullstack / Frontend / Server roles or a CS degree / Bootcamp graduate
Strong programming skills
Familiarity with web architecture concepts
Advantage:
End-to-end development experience (design, development, rollout, production)
Experience with Test-Driven Development (TDD)
Proficiency in JavaScript/Java / Scala/ Node.js / React
Note: The training program will be held only at the Wix Campus in TLV. After the training, you can work at Wix Campus in TLV or in Be’er Sheva

Additional Information

We are Wix Engineering. We work at scale, solve robust challenges, and create with the highest code quality. We put a great deal of focus on our engineering culture, on continuous learning and personal development.
We offer Software Engineering and Computer Science students the opportunity to join our new student program, Wix Enter, and start your engineering career with us. You’ll be working alongside some of the leading engineers in the tech industry.

title: Engineering Planner / Engineering Project Specialist student (BScMSc)
description:
Summary

Posted: Aug 20, 2024

Role Number:200564186

As an Engineering Planner within the HW Technology Program Management organization, you will be assist with Material Management. The Planner will be responsible for driving prototype material - include: requirement collection, building demand / supply plans and distribution to the hands of silicon validation / FW engineers. This position will collaborate with multi-functional teams around the globe. Preferred Planner is a fearless organizer who can prioritize issues and track details to manage the risks associated with early manufacturing builds. You will gather, manage, track and communicate material requirements and data for Apple multiple programs, to different stake holder. You will collaborate with multi-functional teams around the globe : development engineers, validation engineers, Operations and more. You will build and track multiple R&D work plans, control schedule, identify critical path & risks, raise flags and more.

Description

You will lead and manage multiple material projects and logistic aspects end to end: Material demand - collect allocaiotn demand from multiple R&D engineers Supply planning and tracking Material distribution - Manage Income / Outcome shipments to relevant stakeholders Verify all project related material is ready for silicon validation and FW development activities Facilitate weekly status reviews with engineering and operational teams to get project objectives accomplished. It is a dynamic position with interaction with all level of the organization. You will help to define, build and implement Web tools to optimize work processes.
Student for Bsc / Msc in Industrial Engineering and Management
With remaining of min 4 semester to graduation
Please add grade sheet


Preferred Qualifications
Well organized, accurate, high attention to details
Ability to maintaining large quantities of data
Methodic, process oriented
Outstanding multi tasker
Proven ability to work in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment
Strong interpersonal communication skills (written and verbal) with an ability to build work relationships across multi function focal point
High proficient in Excel
Professional level of English (both verbal and written)

title: HubSpot Specialist

Be part of a passionate and innovative team
Ready to take your HubSpot skills to the next level? Apply now and make an impact!

title: SW Engineering Student (Jerusalem)
description:
Summary

Posted: Jul 17, 2024

Role Number:200559546

Will you help us design future generations of revolutionary Apple products? Be inspired every single day. We’re visionaries. Inventors. Forever tinkering with products and processes, always on the lookout for better. A job at Apple is one that requires a lot of you, but it’s also one that rewards forward-thinking, creative thinking and hard work. None of us here at Apple would have it any other way. At Apple, we work every single day to craft products that enrich people’s lives. Do you love working on challenges that no one has solved yet? Do you like changing the game? Bsc Student in Electrical Engineering or Computer science

title: Pricing Analyst - Student position
description:
At Medtronic you can begin a life-long career of exploration and innovation, while helping champion healthcare access and equity for all. You’ll lead with purpose, breaking down barriers to innovation in a more connected, compassionate world.
A Day in the Life
We’re a mission-driven leader in medical technology and solutions with a legacy of integrity and innovation. Work with us to incentivize better patient care, and partner across the industry to make healthcare more affordable and accessible. Be a part of a community of experts committed to ensuring quality, affordable healthcare worldwide. Come strengthen your specialized skills and enhance your expertise. We’ll support you with the training, mentorship, guidance, and networks you need to advance, and empower you to work in the way that’s best for you.
Together, we can confront the challenges that will change the face of healthcare. Join us for a career that changes lives.
We are currently looking for a third year, first degree Economics or Accounting student .
As member of the growing pricing team, you will provide professional and focused services to the sales departments, to maximize Medtronic's profit.
Your day to day will include:
Negotiate contract commercial terms, ensuring they meet requirements of internal stakeholders (i.e., risk, legal, project management, etc.) and client standards
Determine the ideal target customer pricing to drive profitability.
Resolve pricing discrepancies by trouble shooting reasons for exceptions and take proper actions to eliminate reoccurrences.
Provide thorough analytical breakdowns of pricing structures and identify strategic methods to improve pricing models. Communicate findings effectively to relevant departments of the company.
Develop, issue, and manage tender documents (RFPs, RFQ, RFIs, etc.)
Work with the sales and marketing team to define pricing structure for company products.
Partner with the BU to plan, direct, assign and review agreements and tenders to ensure compliance with established policies, regulations and objectives.
Must Haves
A third-year student in Economics or Accounting or Business Administration
High analytical abilities
Excel – high level
High level in English and Hebrew
Ability to work under pressure
Physical Job Requirements

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this position, but they are not an exhaustive list of all the required responsibilities and skills of this position.
Benefits & Compensation
Medtronic offers a competitive Salary and flexible Benefits Package
A commitment to our employees lives at the core of our values. We recognize their contributions. They share in the success they help to create. We offer a wide range of benefits, resources, and competitive compensation plans designed to support you at every career and life stage.

About Medtronic
We lead global healthcare technology and boldly attack the most challenging health problems facing humanity by searching out and finding solutions.
Our Mission — to alleviate pain, restore health, and extend life — unites a global team of 90,000+ passionate people.
We are engineers at heart— putting ambitious ideas to work to generate real solutions for real people. From the R&D lab, to the factory floor, to the conference room, every one of us experiments, creates, builds, improves and solves. We have the talent, diverse perspectives, and guts to engineer the extraordinary.
Learn more about our business, mission, and our commitment to diversity
here

title: Russian Translator
description:
Hello from Freelancer.com! My name is Trishla from Platform, and I'm reaching out to see if you're interested in a project with one of our tech giant clients. They urgently need professional content reviewers fluent in Russian to oversee various content types. The primary goal of Content Reviewers is to support the development of generative AI models and assess diverse content, including audio, video, text, and photos. Reviewers will make judgments based on guidelines to meet project objectives. Attention to detail, critical thinking, and adherence to guidelines are essential. Ideal candidates should be bilingual in Russian and English, with a strong background in content review or editing. They should be adaptable to different content lengths and types, have native language proficiency, cultural knowledge, basic computer skills, logical reasoning, decision-making skills, and openness to a 24/7 work environment. Prior content experience is beneficial. The budget for this project is $16 per hour. description:
Vacancy Date
16/08/2024

13/09/2024

Benefits
At Lexington, we strive to ensure that our colleagues feel appreciated & rewarded, which is why we offer generous rewards & benefits in exchange for your dedicated efforts.

We are currently seeking a skilled and passionate Chef de Partie to join our large brigade. This is an exciting opportunity to work in a dynamic and fast-paced culinary environment.
Job Description
Your key responsibilities as the Chef de Partie Chef will consist of:

– Ensure full area of responsibility is clean, appropriately presented and stocked at all times
– Ensure thorough and up to date knowledge and understanding of menu and special offers in order to provide relevant information to customers and clients
– Be responsible for smooth operation of relevant equipment reporting any maintenance issues in line with procedures
– Ensure all complaint handling is dealt with professionally and in line with procedures
– Ensure that COSHH, Food Safety and Health & Safety regulations are adhered to and any incidents are reported in line with procedures
– Ad-hoc duties to support the catering team and services
Working Pattern: 5 out of 7
Skills and Experience
Responsibilities:
– Prepare and cook delicious and high-quality dishes according to the menu
– Assist in creating and developing new recipes
– Maintain a clean and organized work station
– Work collaboratively with the kitchen team to ensure smooth and efficient operations – Adhere to all food safety and hygiene standards
Requirements:
– Proven experience as a Chef de Partie or line cook
– Culinary diploma or relevant certification
– Strong knowledge of various cooking techniques and cuisines
– Ability to work well under pressure in a fast-paced environment
– Excellent communication and teamwork skills
If you are a dedicated and talented culinary professional looking for an opportunity to showcase your skills in a large brigade, we would love to hear from you. Please submit your resume and cover letter outlining your relevant experience. We look forward to welcoming you to our team!

title: LLM Data Labeler (Part-Time)
description:
Are you an analytical person who is deeply interested in AI and LLM technology?
Is your superpower accurately categorizing information and identifying patterns?
Do you love to solve interesting challenges and make a direct impact through your work?

At Paradox, we believe when you get the people thing right, you can build teams that can change the world. We’re helping organizations around the globe reimagine hiring with our first-of-its-kind recruitment technology. From our Conversational ATS to our best-in-class hiring assessments, Paradox is laser focused on building world class products and a team that our clients love. Our high-performance culture and triple-digit growth have been recognized on Deloitte’s "Fast 500" technology companies, the Inc 5000 list of fastest-growing private companies, and as a Forbes Best Startup Employers. And we’re just getting started. We are looking for top performers who have a track record of success and want to build a company and create the future together.

Join our Tel Aviv team as a Part-Time Data Labeler and help shape the future of AI. We're looking for analytical minds to contribute to our cutting-edge Large Language Model (LLM) project. In this unique role, you'll be performing LLM data tagging tasks, ensuring consistency and quality in our conversations helping design and support our flagship products.

Sound like your perfect fit? We want to hear from you!

As a Data Labeler, you will be responsible for analyzing and tagging data to identify patterns, classifying conversation quality, and optimizing AI performance. In this role, you will:
Analyze and tag conversations between candidates and our AI Assistant, identifying key patterns and classifying them based on quality and relevance.
Perform hands-on data tagging to ensure accuracy and completeness and work across various data sources to maintain consistent and high-quality tagging.
Monitor AI performance, recognizing successes and areas for improvement.
Work closely with our Data Specialists to understand the data needs and ensure tagging processes align with goals ensuring Paradox remains top in class.

Required Qualifications:
Strong technical skills or background
Deep interest and foundational knowledge in Large Language Models (LLMs)
Tech-savvy with experience using web platforms professionally
Fluent in English, including both written and verbal communication
Availability to work a part-time schedule
Ability to learn quickly and maintain attention to detail
Ability to work from our Tel Aviv office
Authorization to work in Israel

Why you should work at Paradox:
Work side by side with passionate, purposeful people - Talent is our DNA and we pride ourselves on having the best!
Ability to make a big impact on a growing organization and drive your own growth
The opportunity to build the next big thing in recruiting technology
Internal and external professional development, coaching, and continuous education opportunities

#LI-DNI

title: Project Manager (Part-time & Remote)
description:
Project Manager (Part-time)
Remote (Israel, EU, U.S.)
About MiA
The Mindfulness in Arabic (MiA) is dedicated to providing culturally adapted, online and in the field trauma-sensitive mindfulness (TSM) training for Arabic Speaking refugees, displaced people, and aid workers. Our effort is to facilitate increased well-being, resilience, and the mindfulness-based reduction of physical suffering, high stress, and mental reactivity to thoughts or emotions. Our vision is to provide refugees with on-demand tools (SE, EFA, TSM) as well as TSM training that will allow them direct and immediate access to a sense of clarity, self-regulation mastery, better self efficacy and well-being. Thus shedding difficult imprints from their flee whilst empowering them to address the daily challenges of transition, communication and decision-making in uncertain, challenging, and/or foreign circumstances. This will help MiA’s end users with raising awareness to stress related symptoms and applying emotional first aid as needed.
What You’ll Do
We are looking for a successful and passionate Project Manager to play a critical role in planning, organizing, and directing resources to achieve specific goals within a defined timeframe and budget established by MiA.
Who You Are
● Proven track record of managing projects as a sole member of management
● Excellent verbal and written communication skills with impeccable attention to detail
● Receptive and welcoming to feedback and coaching
● Bias for action
● Experience generating new opportunities that convert into revenue
● Experience or knowledge with fundraising for NGOs
● Ease of handling phone conversations, as well as zoom, and messaging when required
● Understanding and enthusiasm for social media and uploading content
● Excellence in collaborating and coordinating with multiple team members
Nice to Have
● Genuine Interest and experience in Mindfulness
● Fluency in English, Arabic, and Hebrew and German can be a plus.
● History of achieving and exceeding daily and weekly activity metrics
Minimum Requirements
● The role typically requires 2+ years of experience managing projects.
Job Type: Part-time
Pay: From 60.00₪ per hour
Expected hours: 20 per week

This will help MiA’s end users with raising awareness to stress related symptoms and applying emotional first aid as needed.
What You’ll Do
We are looking for a successful and passionate Project Manager to play a critical role in planning, organizing, and directing resources to achieve specific goals within a defined timeframe and budget established by MiA.
Who You Are
● Proven track record of managing projects as a sole member of management
● Excellent verbal and written communication skills with impeccable attention to detail
● Receptive and welcoming to feedback and coaching
● Bias for action
● Experience generating new opportunities that convert into revenue
● Experience or knowledge with fundraising for NGOs
● Ease of handling phone conversations, as well as zoom, and messaging when required
● Understanding and enthusiasm for social media and uploading content
● Excellence in collaborating and coordinating with multiple team members
Nice to Have
● Genuine Interest and experience in Mindfulness
● Fluency in English, Arabic, and Hebrew and German can be a plus.
● History of achieving and exceeding daily and weekly activity metrics
Minimum Requirements
● The role typically requires 2+ years of experience managing projects.
Job Type: Part-time
Pay: From 60.00₪ per hour
Expected hours: 20 per week

title: Product Design Intern Opportunities
description:
Come build community, explore your passions and do your best work at Microsoft with thousands of University interns from every corner of the world. This opportunity will allow you to bring your aspirations, talent, potential—and excitement for the journey ahead.
Product Designers define specific product needs based on user insights; create and develop design concepts and specifications that optimize the emotional and functional experience of a product, software, device, or service; produce visual designs from concept through delivery and sustainment, and support interaction designs for hardware and/or software-based experiences. This opportunity will allow you to create and communicate compelling product stories and narratives for different audiences.
At Microsoft, Interns work on real-world projects in collaboration with teams across the world, while having fun along the way. You’ll be empowered to build community, explore your passions and achieve your goals. This is your chance to bring your solutions and ideas to life while working on cutting-edge technology.

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

***Our interns work part time, all year round***

Responsibilities
Contribute to visual designs from concept to delivery. Create wireframes, journey maps, user jobs and scenarios, task flows, and personas in support of interaction designs for hardware and/or software-based experiences
Focus on end-to-end user experiences, empathizing and balancing experiences with business and technical tradeoffs.
Contribute to broader design system, increasing its adoption and consistent usage.
Drive cross-team collaboration with the world’s best UX researchers, program managers, product planners and developers from the early stages of planning through implementation.
Research and analyze customer feedback for incorporation into product enhancements, new product designs, and overall design language and strategy.
Produce and validate product design specifications and production requirements.
Negotiate design solutions in relation to business goals.
Qualifications
Currently pursuing a Bachelor's/Master Degree in Visual Communication, Design, HCI or related field.
Must have at least 3 additional full semesters os school remaining to graduation. Graduation date: Winter 2026 or after.
Please include a portfolio showcasing strong visual design, interaction design with problem solving orientation
Familiarity with Figma and Prototyping tools.
Required English language proficiency - spoken and written

Please make sure to apply with your personal email adress and not your university/college email adress.

Due to the duration of our internships and the fixed nature of our start dates, it is not possible for Microsoft to sponsor visas or work permits. To ensure a fair process for all, you must be legally permitted to work in Israel for the duration of the internship to be eligible.
(Legally permitted = Has citizenship or has been granted a valid visa or work permit which will cover you for the duration of your internship)

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.
